name: Mattia Cialoni
bio:
Award Winning Wildlife Filmmaker
Author of "My Neighbour is a Bear"
Help me make my new feature film about wolves:

social_posts.post_text:
Wolves are my favourite animals and the most challenging to film in the wild.
-
I recently had the crazy idea to produce and direct a new feature film about them. A film to be made over the next 2 years, where I'll have to spend so much time in the wild to maximise the chances to film behaviour and to make my new film a reality.
-
I have started a crowdfunding campaign because I really need your help for this big project. If you loved "My Neighbour is a Bear" you'll surely love "My Time with Wolves"!
-
Any contribution that you can make would be beneficial for making this project, and help people more than ever to understand wolves and learn how to coexist with them.
-
More information can be found in this link or in my bio:
https://www.gofundme.com/f/help-me-make-my-new-feature-documentary (Here you can also find the link watch the full film "My Neighbour is a Bear" on youtube)
-
Thank you for your support!
-
VIVA IL LUPO!
-
Cover photo: @gianlucadamiani_photographer
-
-
-

#splendid_animals #exlusive_wildlife #paesaggidabruzzo #world_bestanimal #nature_of_our_world #natgeocreative #animal_sultans #animalelite #bella_shots #explore_wildlife_ #wildlife_perfection #earthfocus #appenninopasseggiando #igersabruzzo #ig_abruzzo #wwfitalia #natgeoyourshot #ig_italia #natgeoadventure #wildlifeplanet #discoveryearth #animalpictures #bbcearth
#naturettl #raccoltafondi

"The call of the wild" 
-
Filming this wolf pack in the wild is fascinating and electric! 
-
The alpha female called the family to attack an intruder (a lone wolf) that was crossing their territory. 
The alpha male (the bigger one with the banana tail) was following her right behind, with their offspring that I used to film last summer when they were just a few months old. How many wolves can you see in the video? 
-
This footage will be part of my new documentary about wolves that I have started shooting and I am planning to continue shooting throughout the next few months.
I have recently launched a crowdfunding campaign to raise money for this project. Any help you could provide would help me tell you a new incredible story! 
-
You can find the link in my bio with more info about the project.
-
-
-
#shooting #wolves🐺 #nature #wolvesofinstagram #earthfocus #travelgram #naturalshot #abruzzo #wildlifedocumentary #wildlifephotography #welltravelled #volgoitalia #natgeoadventure #ig_italia #appenninopasseggiando #instagram #wildlifephotography #wildlife_filmmaking #mountains #wildlifefilmmaker #peaks #naturalshot #trekking #volgoitalia #portrait_ig #ig_portrait #portraitpainting #bella_shots #wolfpack #animalfamily

"My Time with Wolves" 

Some behind the scenes from the shooting in Abruzzo of last winter. 
-
This is just one the the many shootings I've done and I need to do over the next few months in order to tell you another unique story. 
-
After more than one year of work, this film is taking a nice shape and I am happy to see the sense of adventure that it will bring and how it will help the audience to get to know the wolves and eliminate certain preconceptions. 
-
Sharing this story with you is very important for me!
-
If you want to know more and you're happy to help me completing this project, visit the link in my bio and donate if you can. 
-
Every contribution matters! Thank you!
-
-

-
Watching wolf cubs is just amazing! 
I spent many hours observing them playing and interacting with the adults. No doubts they are my favourite animal in the wild (sorry beloved bears).

"Night life in Abruzzo" 
-
Portrait of an ordinary summer night in Villalago, in the Apennine mountains of Italy. 
-
Bear Amarena, the most famous bear of Europe, was the star of my first ever documentary : "My Neighbour is a Bear". She gave birth to four cubs in 2020 and two this year. She recently passed away, killed by a poacher. Her little cub of the four, Juan Carrito, got hit by a car and died this year. Amarena was a bear of a kind. This place simply magical! Reality sucks though!
-
-
-

"Looking for a new adventure"

Making a film about wolves proved to be a tough challenge and I am embracing it all. During this process I've experienced excitement, phisical and mental fatigue, joy, frustration, sadness, spirit of companionship, adrenaline... 
I am still excited looking for them even after hundreds times and many years on the search and I can't stop this feeling.
New adventure coming... 1, 2, 3 GO! 
-
-
-

"Wild Gran Paradiso"

Last year I went to Gran Paradiso National Park in the Italian Alps for a recce. Here's some of the incredible wildlife I encountered.

Alpine chough
Bearded vulture
Alpine chamois
Apennine wolf

My Neighbour is a Bear on TV! 🐻🐻🐻🐻🐻

I am happy to announce that my short film "Il Mio Vicino è un Orso" will be broadcasted in the Italian National TV channel Rai very soon! 

A few years ago this was just a blurred dream but the hard work and many years of commitment finally paid off and I cannot describe how proud I am in this moment.

My Neighbour is a Bear did really well in different film festivals all over the world: finalist several times, including a @wildscreenorg Panda Award nomination and winning @naturvisionfilmfestival , @wildandscenicfilmfestival, @wmf_wemakefuture. 

Since the film was made I cooperated with @arte.tv, @bbcearth, @tv2000it, @offthefencebv, With the UK screening in London organised by @theeuropeannaturetrust I helped raise money for @salviamolorso and towards the protection of the critically endangered Marsican bears.

All of that didn't help to save mum Amarena and Juan Carrito, the smallest cub, both died earlier this year. Juan Carrito was killed in a car accident and Amarena shot by a poacher. 

Although the ending is very sad and dramatic, I wanted to thank this incredible bear family. Wherever you are I'll always be grateful for what you've given me and I feel really sorry for what we've done. 
-
